brief_summary.textblock:
To demonstrate that wavefront-guided LASIK with measurements from iDesign is safe and
      effective in the treatment of mixed astigmatism.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Effectiveness of Wavefront-guided LASIK for the Correction of Mixed Astigmatism

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  At least 18 years of age at the time of pre-operative exam

          -  Best Spectacle Corrected Visual Acuity (BSCVA) of 20/20 or better

          -  Demonstration of refractive stability

          -  Anticipated post-operative stromal bed thickness of at lest 250 microns

          -  Willing and capable of returning for follow-up examinations for the duration of the
             study

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Women who are pregnant, breast-feeding, or intend to become pregnant over the course
             of the study

          -  Concurrent use of topical or systemic medications that may impair healing

          -  History of any medical conditions that could affect wound healing

          -  History of prior intraocular or corneal surgery, active ophthalmic disease,or other
             ocular abnormality

          -  Evidence of keratoconus, corneal irregularity, or abnormal topography in the
             operative eye(s)

          -  Known sensitivity or inappropriate responsiveness to any of the medications used in
             the post-operative course

intervention.description: Surgeons will perform wavefront-guided LASIK based upon measurements obtained with the iDesign System

facility.name: Univerisity of Miami Bascom Palmer Eye Institute

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study to Evaluate the Safety and Effectiveness of Wavefront-Guided LASIK Correction of Mixed Astigmatic Refractive Errors With the iDESIGN Advanced Wavescan Studio™ System and STAR S4 IR™ Excimer Laser System

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: < 5% of eyes with a loss of > 2 lines of BSCVA
primary_outcome.measure: Line loss of less than two lines for Best Spectacle Corrected Visual Acuity (BSCVA)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: 85% of eyes with a UCVA of 20/40 or better
secondary_outcome.measure: Uncorrected Visual Acuity (UCVA) of 20/40 or better

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
